intro: Symplocos hebantha, commonly known as the slender wax myrtle, is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its flowers are white and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Symplocos hebantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
